summaries.brief_summary: Major cmdliner 2.0.0 release coordination with ecosystem-wide compatibility updates plus numerous package releases
summaries.new_features_summary: Cmdliner 2.0.0 breaking changes required extensive package constraint updates across the ecosystem
summaries.new_features:
- **Cmdliner 2.0.0** release with breaking changes requiring ecosystem-wide coordination ([#28599](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28599), [#28602](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28602), [#28603](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28603))
- **Windows MinGW support** improvements including new conf-gtksourceview3 MinGW packages and CI workflow ([#28585](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28585), [#28598](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28598))
- **Package constraint automation** for cmdliner compatibility affecting 200+ packages with upper-bound constraints ([3c6a0f5](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/3c6a0f524c62627fc4bb9a8b8d9cda1d8f4d26e9))
summaries.activity_summary: Heavy package release activity with 20+ new versions plus ongoing cmdliner compatibility work
summaries.activity:
- **Major new packages opened** this week include postgresql 5.3.2 by [Markus Mottl](https://github.com/mmottl) ([#28605](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28605)), uring 2.7.0 by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([#28604](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28604)), and moonpool 0.9 by [Simon Cruanes](https://github.com/c-cube) ([#28597](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28597))
- **Cmdliner 2.0.0 ecosystem coordination** dominated the week with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) leading release preparation ([#28599](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28599)), [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) handling opam tooling constraints ([#28601](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28601)), and [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) providing follow-up fixes ([#28603](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28603))
- **Network stack releases** delivered by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) with TLS 2.0.3 ([#28590](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28590)) and DNS 10.2.1 ([#28582](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28582)) plus related security improvements
- **Static site generation** advancement with YoCaml 2.6.0 release including 13 packages by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([#28571](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28571))
- **Infrastructure improvements** by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding Windows MSys2 CI workflow ([#28598](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28598)) and MinGW package support ([#28585](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28585))
- **System programming releases** from [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) with Solo5 0.9.3 ([#28570](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28570)) and progress 0.5.0 ([#28569](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28569))
summaries.trends_summary: Breaking change coordination shows strong ecosystem collaboration and automated constraint management
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Ecosystem-wide breaking change management** demonstrates mature coordination processes with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) leading cmdliner 2.0.0 release while community systematically handles compatibility ([#28599](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28599), [#28601](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28601), [#28602](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28602), [#28603](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28603))
- **Cross-platform support expansion** with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) systematically improving Windows compatibility through MinGW tooling and CI infrastructure ([#28585](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28585), [#28598](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28598))
- **Network security focus** with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) releasing coordinated TLS and DNS updates suggesting ongoing security improvements ([#28582](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28582), [#28590](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28590))
- **Package constraint automation** showing improved tooling for handling dependency compatibility at scale with hundreds of packages updated simultaneously
summaries.contributors_summary: 27 contributors with strong coordination led by dbuenzli, kit-ty-kate, jmid, and hannesm across ecosystem management
summaries.contributors:
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) orchestrated the cmdliner 2.0.0 release with ecosystem-wide compatibility planning ([#28599](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28599), [#28602](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28602), [#28606](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28606), [#28607](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28607)) and provided extensive coordination across package maintainers
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) handled opam tooling compatibility with cmdliner 2.0.0, implementing automated constraint updates across core opam packages ([#28601](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28601)) and coordinating with ecosystem maintainers
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) expanded Windows support by implementing MinGW compatibility for conf-gtksourceview3 ([#28585](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28585)), adding Windows MSys2 CI workflow ([#28598](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28598)), and cleaning up CI infrastructure
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) delivered network stack updates with TLS 2.0.3 release ([#28590](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28590)), DNS 10.2.1 with 13 packages ([#28582](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28582)), and reported Windows compatibility issues ([#28592](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28592))
- [Markus Mottl](https://github.com/mmottl) worked on postgresql releases with version 5.3.1 debugging ([#28575](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28575)) and opened 5.3.2 ([#28605](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28605)) for compilation improvements
- [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) provided follow-up fixes for cmdliner constraint issues ([#28603](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28603)) and supported ecosystem compatibility efforts
- [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) released monolith 20250922 ([#28565](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28565)) and intPQueue 20250925 ([#28584](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28584))
- [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) contributed system programming releases including Solo5 0.9.3 ([#28570](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28570)) and progress 0.5.0 with new terminal package ([#28569](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28569))
- [@xvw](https://github.com/xvw) delivered YoCaml 2.6.0 release with 13 packages for static site generation ([#28571](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28571))
- [@mbarbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) released pplumbing 0.0.16 with 6 packages ([#28572](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28572)) and cmdlang 0.0.10 ([#28562](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28562))

summaries.brief_summary: New package releases with CI infrastructure fixes and extensive lwt6 compatibility updates across the ecosystem
summaries.new_features_summary: Two new packages released: crs code review tool and proton database driver, plus lwt compatibility updates
summaries.new_features:
- **Code review management tool** [crs](https://github.com/mbarbin/crs) version 0.0.20250914 by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) for managing embedded review comments with CI integration ([#28522](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28522))
- **High-performance database driver** [proton](https://github.com/mfreeman451/proton-ocaml-driver) version 1.0.15 by [Michael Freeman](https://github.com/mfreeman451) for Timeplus Proton with streaming queries, compression (LZ4/ZSTD), and TLS ([#28518](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28518))
- **lwt6 compatibility** updates across 65+ packages by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) including dream, caqti-lwt, lambda-term, lwt_domain, and others ([#28482](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28482))
- **Dream framework compatibility** fixes with lwt_ppx upper bounds for alpha versions by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28520](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28520))
summaries.activity_summary: CI infrastructure crisis resolved, multiple new packages opened, and extensive package maintenance work completed
summaries.activity:
- **Critical CI infrastructure issue** resolved with conf-gmp.1 marked as avoid version by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) to address GCC 14 compatibility problems ([#28540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28540), [#28541](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28541))
- **New packages opened** this week including zanuda linter 2.0.0 with OCaml 5.3 support by [Dmitrii Kosarev](https://github.com/Kakadu) ([#28537](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28537)), portmidi 0.4 MIDI bindings by [Michael Bacarella](https://github.com/mbacarella) ([#28531](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28531)), and dune upper bound constraints for tezt by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28550](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28550))
- **Multiple package releases** merged including coq-lsp versions for OCaml 8.20, 9.0, and 9.1 ([#28532](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28532), [#28533](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28533), [#28534](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28534)), iomux 0.4 with macOS fixes by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([#28535](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28535)), and elpi 3.4.0 lambda prolog interpreter ([#28536](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28536))
- **Package maintenance** work including typo fixes in archiving documentation by [Jean-Christophe Léchenet](https://github.com/eponier) ([#28546](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28546)) and ongoing smtml package testing by [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom) ([#28526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28526))
summaries.trends_summary: CI robustness focus with system dependency management and widespread compatibility updates for ecosystem evolution
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **System dependency resilience** becoming critical as distribution upgrades (Debian 13, GCC 14) affect conf-package compatibility, requiring proactive avoid constraints and better testing
- **OCaml 5.3 adoption** accelerating with multiple packages adding explicit support including zanuda linter and broader ecosystem compatibility work
- **Infrastructure tooling** expansion with specialized tools like crs for code review management and high-performance database drivers like proton for modern data processing
- **Ecosystem coordination** efforts around major library transitions (lwt6) requiring systematic compatibility updates across 65+ dependent packages
- **Build system evolution** challenges with dune 3.19.0 changes affecting test frameworks and requiring careful upper bound management
summaries.contributors_summary: 26 unique contributors with infrastructure fixes, new package submissions, and systematic compatibility updates
summaries.contributors:
- [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) resolved critical CI infrastructure issues with conf-gmp compatibility ([#28540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28540)) and implemented comprehensive lwt6 compatibility updates across 65+ packages ([#28482](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28482))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) opened CI issue report ([#28541](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28541)), fixed dream framework lwt_ppx bounds ([#28520](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28520)), and opened dune constraint PR for tezt ([#28550](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28550))
- [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) released crs 0.0.20250914 code review management tool with comprehensive features for embedded comment management ([#28522](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28522))
- [@mfreeman451](https://github.com/mfreeman451) released proton 1.0.15 high-performance database driver for Timeplus Proton with streaming capabilities ([#28518](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28518))
- [@Kakadu](https://github.com/Kakadu) opened zanuda 2.0.0 OCaml linter with OCaml 5.3 support ([#28537](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28537))
- [@mbacarella](https://github.com/mbacarella) submitted portmidi 0.4 MIDI bindings package with ongoing CI resolution work ([#28531](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28531))
- [@avsm](https://github.com/avsm) released iomux 0.4 IO multiplexer with macOS compatibility improvements ([#28535](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28535))
- [@eponier](https://github.com/eponier) contributed documentation fixes with typo corrections in archiving documentation ([#28546](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28546))
- [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom) conducted ongoing testing and review work for smtml package submission ([#28526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28526))
- [@hannesm](https://github.com/hannesm) initiated policy discussion about archival scheduling and OCaml version updates ([#28489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28489))

summaries.brief_summary: Heavy Windows/MinGW cross-platform support improvements by Jan Midtgaard with 36 package merges and 63 new PRs
summaries.new_features_summary: MinGW support for graphics libraries, maintenance intent metadata support in dune-project files
summaries.new_features:
- **MinGW and Cygwin cross-platform support** added for multiple graphics libraries by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid): cairo ([14bad9e](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/14bad9e)), freetype ([921d330](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/921d330)), SDL2 components including sdl2-net ([95babba](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/95babba), [4ed5741](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/4ed5741)), sdl2-mixer ([f1f4f09](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f1f4f09)), and liblz4 support enabling Windows native development
- **Enhanced archival policy documentation** with `maintenance_intent` field support in dune-project files ([720317d](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/720317d))
- **OCaml 5.4.0~beta2 compiler packages** added for early testing and compatibility validation ([995dbb4](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/995dbb4))
summaries.activity_summary: Major Windows platform improvements, new package releases, and ongoing OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem preparation work
summaries.activity:
- **New package releases opened** include why3.1.8.2 formal verification platform by [Claude Marché](https://github.com/claudemarche) ([#28511](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28511)), ocaml-protoc-plugin 6.2.0 Protocol Buffer support by [Anders Peter Fugmann](https://github.com/andersfugmann) ([#28412](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28412)), and comprehensive chess library updates for chess_com_api and lichess_api ([#28521](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28521))
- **Windows development ecosystem** received comprehensive **MinGW support** through [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid)'s merged PRs adding native Windows compilation for graphics libraries: freetype ([#28515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28515)), cairo with Cygwin fixes ([#28514](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28514)), SDL2 components including sdl2-net ([#28513](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28513)), sdl2-mixer ([#28512](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28512)), sdl2-ttf ([#28510](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28510)), and SDL2_image ([#28507](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28507))
- **Package maintenance** featured crs.0.0.20250914 code review tool with OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility ([#28522](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28522)), proton.1.0.15 high-performance database driver ([#28518](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28518)), vsrocq-language-server.2.3.0 LSP support ([#28501](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28501)), and educational coq-waterproof.3.0.0 releases for multiple Coq versions ([#28500](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28500), [#28498](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28498))
- **Dependency management** improvements addressed **lwt_ppx upper bounds** for dream alpha releases ([#28520](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28520)), comprehensive **LWT 6.0 compatibility** constraints across ecosystem packages ([#28482](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28482)), and critical **Tezos checksum corrections** for rust-libs versions ([#28491](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28491))
summaries.discussions_summary: Repository governance discussions on archival policies and OCaml version support strategies
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Archival policy coordination** initiated by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) addressing periodic archival scheduling and **minimal OCaml version support** strategy, questioning current 4.08 baseline and proposing 4.14 LTS alignment with Debian stable transitions ([#28489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28489))
- **OCaml 5.4.0 release preparation** ongoing coordination tracked by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) noting **ppxlib ecosystem split** affecting ~373 remaining packages requiring updates for < 0.36 vs >= 0.36 compatibility ([#27916](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27916))
summaries.trends_summary: Systematic cross-platform Windows support expansion and proactive dependency management for major ecosystem transitions
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform development renaissance** led by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) with systematic **MinGW and Cygwin support** implementation across graphics libraries, enabling native Windows executable generation vs. Cygwin-dependent builds through template-driven consistent package integration patterns
- **OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem transition** acceleration with **beta2 compiler packages** introduction and growing new package OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility, while addressing the **ppxlib ecosystem split** blocking ~373 packages requiring migration between < 0.36 and >= 0.36 versions
- **Package maintenance sophistication** evolution featuring enhanced `x-maintenance-intent` metadata usage, **dune-project maintenance_intent** field integration for automated archival policy compliance, and complex **cross-package constraint coordination** for ecosystem-wide compatibility management
- **Dependency management maturation** demonstrating **lock-step versioning** coordination for multi-package repositories, proactive **upper bound management** preventing CI noise, and sophisticated **breaking change orchestration** exemplified by LWT 6.0 alpha constraint coordination across numerous dependent packages
summaries.contributors_summary: Jan Midtgaard led major Windows support expansion, Kate coordinated ecosystem management, and Hannes Mehnert initiated governance discussions
summaries.contributors:
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) delivered **outstanding cross-platform contribution** implementing comprehensive **Windows MinGW support** across graphics libraries through merged PRs for freetype ([#28515](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28515)), cairo ([#28514](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28514)), SDL2 ecosystem ([#28513](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28513), [#28512](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28512), [#28510](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28510), [#28507](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28507)), and liblz4 ([#28505](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28505)) with detailed documentation and extensive testing
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) managed **OCaml compiler ecosystem coordination** including 5.4.0 release preparation oversight, **package compatibility management** across 373 remaining packages requiring ppxlib migration, and **dependency constraint reviews** for ecosystem stability
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) initiated **repository governance discussions** on archival policy scheduling and **minimal OCaml version support** strategy, questioning 4.08 baseline and proposing 4.14 LTS alignment ([#28489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28489))
- [@claudemarche](https://github.com/claudemarche) maintained **why3 formal verification platform** with 1.8.2 release submission ([#28511](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28511)) and [@andersfugmann](https://github.com/andersfugmann) continued **ocaml-protoc-plugin development** with 6.2.0 Protocol Buffer compiler enhancement ([#28412](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28412))
- [@mbarbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) developed **crs code review management tool** with OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility and [@mfreeman451](https://github.com/mfreeman451) maintained **proton database driver** with 1.0.15 performance improvements
- [@raphael-proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) coordinated **LWT ecosystem management** with comprehensive 6.0 alpha compatibility constraints and [@mtelvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) provided **infrastructure maintenance** fixing critical Tezos checksum issues

summaries.brief_summary: Productive week with 28 merged PRs, new package releases, and infrastructure improvements across multiple domains
summaries.new_features_summary: New packages added including scope image viewer, ppx_format, and multiple library updates with bug fixes
summaries.new_features:
- **New scope image viewer** by [Charles Averill](https://github.com/CharlesAverill) for OCaml with SDL2 support ([#28434](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28434), [#28457](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28457))
- **PPX format extension** by [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) allowing inline format specifier syntax for printf-style functions ([#28450](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28450))
- **Enhanced DHCP support** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) with client FQDN support and runtime configuration options in charrua 2.1.0 ([#28432](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28432))
- **Memory and allocation limits** with new memprof-limits 0.3.0 by [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) providing per-thread limits and cancellation ([#28442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28442))
- **MirageOS unikraft support** added by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) across mirage-mtime, mirage-ptime, and mirage-sleep packages ([#28423](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28423), [#28424](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28424), [#28425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28425))
- **Goblint static analysis** improvements with version 2.6.0 adding division by zero analysis, bitfield domain, and C-2PO pointer analysis ([#28447](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28447))
- **Version compatibility fixes** by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) addressing yojson and OCaml compiler compatibility issues ([#28445](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28445), [#28446](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28446))
summaries.activity_summary: Package maintenance focus with opam-build updates, compiler compatibility fixes, and ongoing discussions around Windows toolchain support
summaries.activity:
- **New packages opened** this week including system-cygwin support request by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#28415](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28415)), ocaml-system support for 5.4.0/5.5.0 by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#28455](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28455)), and cudd bindings by [@yarukha](https://github.com/yarukha) ([#28422](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28422))
- **Package maintenance updates** with opam-build/opam-test 0.2.6 by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#28454](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28454)), runtime_events_tools 0.5.3 by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#28452](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28452)), and tinyfiledialogs bindings by [Charles Averill](https://github.com/CharlesAverill) ([#28456](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28456))
- **Dune ecosystem** activity with version 3.20.2 merged by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) fixing js_of_ocaml compilation and cram test issues ([#28437](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28437))
- **Chess and gaming libraries** updated by [Boris Novoselov](https://github.com/Ckaf) with chess_com_api, lichess_api, and pgn_parser 1.0.1 ([#28416](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28416))
- **Protocol and networking** improvements with liquidsoap 2.4.0 by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) ([#28429](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28429)) and multiple MirageOS component updates
- **Static site generation** progress with YOCaml 2.4.1 by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) adding TOC traversal and markdown package reintroduction ([#28430](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28430))
- **Version control tooling** enhanced with volgo 0.0.21 by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) improving git operations and bit vector handling ([#28410](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28410))
summaries.discussions_summary: Active discussions around Windows toolchain coinstallation issues and MSVC compiler compatibility
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Windows MinGW toolchain conflicts** reported by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) where conf-mingw-w64-gcc packages cannot be coinstalled on msys2, blocking opam-core installation ([#28431](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28431))
- **OCaml 5.3.0 Arch Linux installation failure** investigated by [Vincent Bernardoff](https://github.com/vbmithr) and [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA), traced to configure script PATH ordering issues ([#28438](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28438))
- **Package maintenance discussions** around conf-protoc Windows support and C++ compiler version requirements affecting protobuf-related packages ([#28412](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28412))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on Windows platform support, MirageOS ecosystem expansion, and proactive compatibility maintenance
summaries.emerging_trends:

- **MirageOS unikraft integration** expanding ecosystem support for new deployment targets with consistent API additions ([#28423](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28423), [#28424](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28424), [#28425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28425))
- **Proactive version compatibility** maintenance with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) leading efforts to address library version conflicts and compiler changes ([#28445](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28445), [#28446](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28446))

summaries.brief_summary: Active week with 31 merged PRs including major Dune 3.20.1 update, Windows support enhancements, and new SMT solver packages
summaries.new_features_summary: New chess game development ecosystem, enhanced Windows development support, improved SMT solver integrations, and updated async I/O libraries
summaries.new_features:
- **Chess game development ecosystem** with three new packages: pgn_parser for PGN format parsing, lichess_api for Lichess API integration, and chess_com_api for Chess.com API access ([#28404](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28404))
- **Enhanced Windows development support** including conf-gtk2 MinGW/MSys2/Cygwin compatibility ([#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387)), conf-gtk3 MinGW/MSys2 support ([#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389)), and libao Windows platform support ([#28376](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28376))
- **SMT solver ecosystem improvements** with smtml 0.10.0 offering enhanced solver frontend capabilities ([#28399](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28399)) and cvc5 1.3.0-1 OCaml bindings ([#28419](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28419))
- **Build system stability** through Dune 3.20.1 update fixing runtest-js dependency issues across 15 packages ([#28397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28397))
- **Async I/O improvements** with Lwt 5.9.2 core library update and lwt_ppx preprocessing enhancements ([#28384](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28384))
- **Dead code analysis tooling** with new dead_code_analyzer 1.0.0 package for OCaml code quality assessment ([#28417](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28417))
- **Audio file format support** through new ocue 0.1.0 library for reading cue files ([#28418](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28418))
- **Package deprecation cleanup** with fswatch and conf-fswatch properly deprecated due to fundamental design issues affecting macOS Silicon thread model ([#28396](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28396))
summaries.activity_summary: Strong package maintenance activity with 31 merged PRs covering core infrastructure updates, new gaming-related packages, and ecosystem improvements
summaries.activity:
- **Three PRs opened** this week for major upcoming releases including ocaml-protoc-plugin 6.2.0 protocol buffer improvements ([#28412](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28412)), cvc5 SMT solver bindings ([#28419](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28419)), and dead_code_analyzer tool ([#28417](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28417))
- **Core infrastructure updates** delivered through [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) merging Dune 3.20.1 across 15 packages ([#28397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28397)), [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) updating GitHub API libraries to 4.5.0 ([#28390](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28390)), and [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) improving Lwt async libraries ([#28384](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28384))
- **Mirage ecosystem maintenance** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) across five PRs including mirage-crypto 2.0.2 security updates ([#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382)), protocol-9p 2.1.0 compatibility ([#28394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28394)), hvsock 3.1.0 Hyper-V improvements ([#28393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28393)), and mirage-mtime 5.1.0 clock enhancements ([#28392](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28392))
- **Windows platform support expansion** by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) through seven merged PRs covering GTK library support ([#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387), [#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389)), dependency bound fixes ([#28400](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28400), [#28371](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28371), [#28372](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28372)), and URL corrections ([#28407](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28407))
- **Gaming and multimedia packages** including chess development tools ([#28404](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28404)), FFmpeg bindings update to 1.2.6 ([#28401](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28401)), and audio file format support ([#28418](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28418))
- **Formal verification ecosystem** growth with smtml solver frontend improvements ([#28399](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28399)), Ortac 0.7.2 specification testing updates ([#28403](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28403)), and Coq-waterproof educational packages ([#28402](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28402), [#28405](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28405))
summaries.discussions_summary: Feature request for Cygwin Windows support and resolution of long-standing fswatch packaging issues
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Cygwin Windows support request** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for system-cygwin package similar to existing system-mingw and system-msvc, important for setup-ocaml and ensuring sound Cygwin builds ([#28415](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28415))
- **fswatch deprecation decision** resolving long-standing packaging issues in Ubuntu/Debian distributions with problematic library design affecting macOS Silicon thread model and development package availability ([#22256](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/22256))
summaries.trends_summary: Growing focus on Windows development support, formal verification tools, and gaming applications within the OCaml ecosystem
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Windows ecosystem strengthening** with systematic improvements to MinGW, MSys2, and Cygwin support across GUI toolkits and audio libraries, demonstrating commitment to cross-platform development
- **Gaming and chess development emergence** as new application domain with comprehensive API integrations for major chess platforms and PGN format parsing capabilities
- **Formal verification ecosystem expansion** through enhanced SMT solver integrations, specification testing tools, and educational proof systems, supporting academic and industrial verification use cases
- **Package quality improvements** through proactive deprecation of problematic libraries and comprehensive dependency bound maintenance, ensuring ecosystem stability

summaries.brief_summary: Active week with major package releases including Dune 3.20.0, TLS 2.0.2, and enhanced Windows platform support
summaries.new_features_summary: New package releases, Windows GTK support, dependency fixes, and infrastructure improvements
summaries.new_features:
- **Dune 3.20.0 release** with 15 packages providing build system improvements [#28357](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28357)

- **Windows platform support** for GTK2 and GTK3 libraries across MinGW, MSys2, and Cygwin platforms [#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387), [#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389)

- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility** fixes with refl package upper bounds [#28364](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28364)

- **Alpine Linux package improvements** using upstream ninja instead of samurai [#28365](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28365)
summaries.activity_summary: 22 package releases merged with focus on MirageOS ecosystem, cryptography, and build tools
summaries.activity:
- **New package releases** dominated activity with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) delivering **MirageOS ecosystem updates** including hvsock 3.1.0 ([#28393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28393)), protocol-9p 2.1.0 ([#28394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28394)), mirage-crypto 2.0.2 ([#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382)), mirage-mtime 5.1.0 ([#28392](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28392)), albatross 2.5.1 ([#28369](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28369)), and mirage-net-xen 2.1.6 ([#28349](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28349))
- **Cross-platform compatibility** enhanced by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) with comprehensive **Windows support** for GUI libraries including conf-gtk2 ([#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387)), conf-gtk3 ([#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389)), and libao ([#28376](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28376)), plus **dependency maintenance** work fixing pg_query bounds ([#28372](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28372)), ppx_rapper compatibility ([#28371](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28371), [#28370](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28370)), OCaml 5.3 support ([#28364](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28364)), and opam-compiler bounds ([#28375](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28375))

- **Academic and research tools** updated with [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) releasing unionFind.20250818 ([#28350](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28350)), [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi) publishing ocannl 0.6.0 ([#28367](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28367)) and cudajit 0.7.2 ([#28363](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28363)), and [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) releasing slipshow 0.6.0 ([#28351](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28351))

summaries.trends_summary: Ecosystem consolidation around MirageOS, Windows platform support, and dependency maintenance

summaries.brief_summary: Active week with 25 package releases and 23 new PRs opened, including new frameworks and library updates.
summaries.new_features_summary: New packages include terminal UI framework Mosaic, web framework Vif, HTTP client tools, and multiple version updates.
summaries.new_features:
- New **terminal UI framework** Mosaic offering React-inspired TUI development with OCaml 5 effects ([#28326](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28326))
- **Web framework Vif** for OCaml 5 providing simple web application development ([#28344](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28344))
- **HTTP client Hurl** as command-line tool for HTTP requests and testing ([#28343](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28343))
- **Httpcats HTTP client** with websocket support using h1, h2, and miou ([#28322](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28322))
- **GPX parsing library** mlgpx for GPS Exchange format handling with streaming support ([#28338](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28338))

summaries.brief_summary: Major week with 9 new packages, QCheck 0.26 release, js_of_ocaml 6.1.1 update, and extensive dependency bound fixes

summaries.activity_summary: Extensive dependency bound maintenance affecting containers, goblint, and prbnmcn-stats packages plus platform compatibility fixes
summaries.activity:

- **Platform compatibility fixes** by [Yishuai Li](https://github.com/liyishuai) including OCaml version constraints for camlimages 5.0.5 ([fe6ca86](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/fe6ca8673e490d5c3a537ba861456ee02fe567b3)), macOS availability fixes for freetds 0.7 ([fd85e73](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/fd85e739b0ebd4a0e8c2f74b9f13e741504adce4)), and base package patches for v0.14.3 and v0.15.1 ([072772f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/072772f4cdfa2b101ccbcb04c710fc7943cd23db))
- **Additional package updates** including logs-async compatibility ([96cb4bc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/96cb4bcb7aba60e45d99c0b63825183255a32fb3)), Frama-C lannotate and luncov 0.2.4 releases ([22035717](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/22035717439898d62260cfd1cb3e2be6ca1df9e1)), and gettext 0.4.2 fileutils compatibility fix ([072772f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/072772f4cdfa2b101ccbcb04c710fc7943cd23db))
- **Configuration packages** additions including conf-gegl and conf-taglib_c support ([df0c9cc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/df0c9cc43246ab5887ce06e4f5529a767966a043))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on dependency maintenance, compatibility fixes, and tooling improvements for opam ecosystem health
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Proactive dependency maintenance** with systematic upper bound additions to prevent build failures from incompatible package combinations, particularly around QCheck ecosystem changes
- **Platform-specific compatibility** improvements ensuring packages work correctly across different operating systems and OCaml versions
- **Tooling ecosystem growth** with new packages like opam-ci-check-lint supporting better development workflows and package validation
- **JavaScript compilation advancement** through js_of_ocaml 6.1.1 maintaining OCaml's web development capabilities
summaries.contributors_summary: Multiple active contributors including Jan Midtgaard with dependency updates, Yishuai Li with compatibility fixes, and package maintainers
summaries.contributors:

- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) released **js_of_ocaml 6.1.1** with comprehensive package updates and gen_js_api compatibility fixes ([cd1d2da](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/cd1d2da68c683279e78955ec39c84fe1e9771480), [f0a1651](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f0a16514e07cc28bbe2521a9163153010aa804ee))

- **Daniel Bünzli** released logs 0.9.0 logging library update ([64169c3](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/64169c3d1d6774ef4ce0fcc471269bb09cd215f5))

summaries.activity_summary: Active discussion on package versioning policy and maintenance timeline sparked by Rocq Platform requirements
summaries.activity:
- **OPAM 2.4.0-rc1 ecosystem release** delivered comprehensive update with 8 core packages including opam-client, opam-core, opam-format, opam-solver, and opam-state providing release candidate functionality for testing
- **js_of_ocaml 6.1.0 major release** brought updated compiler, lwt integration, ppx extensions, toplevel support, tyxml integration, and new WebAssembly compiler capabilities across 8 coordinated packages
- **Data science ecosystem expansion** through raven 1.0.0~alpha0 suite introducing 9 alpha packages for data analysis including nx (core), nx-datasets, nx-text, hugin, kaun, quill, rune, and sowilo for comprehensive data processing workflows
- **Testing framework advancement** with Ortac 0.7.0 delivering updated property-based testing capabilities through 6 packages covering core functionality, dune integration, QCheck STM support, and runtime libraries
- **OCaml 5.3.0 compatibility maintenance** addressing compatibility constraints across multiple packages including cohttp-async updates, dune 3.15.3 upper bound fixes, gen_js_api compatibility patches, and jsoo-react ppxlib constraint updates
- **Security and cryptography updates** including binsec 0.10.1 binary analysis platform release, jasmin 2025.06.0 cryptographic compiler update, and ca-certs-nss 3.113.1 certificate bundle refresh
summaries.discussions_summary: Important policy discussion about package retention periods affecting platform maintainers
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Package archival policy debate** initiated by [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung) regarding automatic removal of old dune versions causing CI performance issues for Rocq Platform ([#28065](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28065))
- **Maintenance strategy discussion** between platform maintainers and repository maintainers exploring solutions including version pinning URLs, stable commit references, and legacy repository usage
- **Performance vs. compatibility trade-offs** discussed regarding repository split benefits versus platform build reproducibility needs with multiple stakeholders contributing perspectives on long-term maintenance approaches
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on OCaml 5.3.0 ecosystem compatibility and major version releases across tooling
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.3.0 ecosystem preparation** showing comprehensive compatibility testing and constraint updates across multiple package families
- **Major toolchain releases** with significant updates to core OCaml infrastructure including OPAM 2.4.0-rc1 and js_of_ocaml 6.1.0 coordinated releases
- **Data science ecosystem development** evidenced by coordinated alpha release of 9 raven ecosystem packages for comprehensive data analysis workflows
- **Platform maintenance policy evolution** highlighting tension between repository performance optimization and downstream platform stability requirements
summaries.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors delivered major releases with ecosystem coordination across OPAM, js_of_ocaml, and new data science packages
summaries.contributors:
- [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) coordinated multiple package releases and maintained repository policies including dune compatibility fixes and snf_mcp 0.2.0 release
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) managed ca-certs-nss 3.113.1 release and participated extensively in package retention policy discussions providing guidance on maintenance strategies
- **Multiple package maintainers** delivered coordinated releases including js_of_ocaml 6.1.0 suite (8 packages), OPAM 2.4.0-rc1 toolchain (8 packages), raven ecosystem alpha releases (9 packages), and Ortac 0.7.0 testing framework (6 packages)
- [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung) raised important policy questions about package archival timelines affecting downstream platform maintainers and build reproducibility
- **Security and tooling contributors** delivered updates across binsec 0.10.1, jasmin 2025.06.0, smtml 0.8.0, and various compatibility patches for OCaml 5.3.0 ecosystem support

summaries.brief_summary: Major package releases and policy discussions, with 119 files changed across multiple new package versions and compatibility updates.

summaries.activity_summary: Three repository issues addressing package archival policies, GCC 14 compatibility, and Merlin version availability.
summaries.activity:
- **Package archival policy** discussion initiated by [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung) regarding automatic removal of old Dune versions affecting CI systems, with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) coordinating restoration efforts and policy improvements ([#28065](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28065))
- **GCC 14 build compatibility** issue resolved by [Jason Conroy](https://github.com/conroj) and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) addressing incompatible-pointer-types errors in plplot package ([#28095](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28095))
- **Merlin version confusion** quickly resolved by [Mohamed Hernouf](https://github.com/hernoufM) with guidance from [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) regarding OCaml 4.14 compatibility ([#28075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28075))
summaries.trends_summary: Repository maintenance patterns emerging around automated archival, ecosystem compatibility with newer compiler versions, and cross-community coordination.
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Automated package archival** creating unexpected CI breakages requiring improved communication strategies and tooling support for detecting soon-to-be-archived dependencies
- **Compiler compatibility maintenance** with systematic updates across the ecosystem for OCaml 5.4 and GCC 14 support, indicating maturation of the toolchain
- **Cross-community impact** of opam repository changes affecting non-OCaml users (Rocq/Coq community), highlighting the need for broader communication channels
- **Package restoration workflows** being established for critical dependencies that were inadvertently archived, with new maintenance marking mechanisms
summaries.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors addressed repository maintenance, compatibility issues, and policy improvements through issues and extensive commit activity.
summaries.contributors:
- [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung) opened the package archival policy discussion, providing detailed feedback from the Rocq user perspective and suggesting improvements to opam error messaging ([#28065](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28065))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) coordinated responses to archival issues, restored dune 3.17.2, created announcement posts, and participated extensively in policy discussions ([#28065](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28065))
- [Jason Conroy](https://github.com/conroj) identified and reported GCC 14 compatibility issues, volunteered to implement fixes, and engaged with upstream plplot maintenance ([#28095](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28095))
- [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) facilitated plplot release preparation, managed package updates, and coordinated the resolution of build compatibility issues ([#28095](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28095))
- [Mohamed Hernouf](https://github.com/hernoufM) reported Merlin version availability confusion and received quick resolution guidance ([#28075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28075))
- Multiple package authors contributed new releases and updates, including significant commits for Irmin, Merlin, LSP, and various compatibility fixes across the ecosystem

summaries.brief_summary: Major package releases including Dune 3.19.1, Base v0.17.3, OCaml-Unikraft 1.0.0, Sail 0.19.1, and deprecation of duppy/dtools packages
summaries.new_features_summary: Major new packages and infrastructure improvements: Dune 3.19.1, Base v0.17.3, OCaml-Unikraft 1.0.0, Windows CI cache fixes
summaries.new_features:
- **Dune 3.19.1** release with 15 new package versions providing build system updates ([c7269f7](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/c7269f7))
- **Base ecosystem v0.17.3** release including comprehensive updates to base libraries, PPX tools, and testing frameworks ([fee7f3f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/fee7f3f), [a91bc3e](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/a91bc3e))
- **OCaml-Unikraft 1.0.0** complete infrastructure for unikernel development with ARM64 and x86_64 support, backends for QEMU and Firecracker ([f08d434](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f08d434))
- **Sail 0.19.1** specification language with 12 backend packages for formal verification ([e8b423f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e8b423f))
- **CamlIDL 1.13** interface generator for C bindings by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) ([11a272b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/11a272b))
- **Windows CI infrastructure** fixes resolving cache corruption issues affecting MinGW builds ([ff69880](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/ff69880))
- **Package deprecation** warnings added to duppy and dtools packages with removal from liquidsoap dependencies ([5df1368](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/5df1368))
- **Cross-platform configuration** improvements for Windows/Cygwin support in conf-gtk3, conf-cairo, conf-mpfr ([29d3c44](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/29d3c44), [85b1784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/85b1784), [4f70d22](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/4f70d22))
- **Version control tools** enhancement with conf-hg package providing cross-platform Mercurial support ([11b72d2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/11b72d2))
summaries.activity_summary: Package maintenance with CI improvements, Windows build fixes, dependency constraints, and ecosystem coordination efforts
summaries.activity:
- **Windows CI infrastructure** resolved by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) reporting cache issues affecting MinGW builds ([#28007](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28007)) and [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) implementing fixes ([#28011](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28011), [#28016](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28016))
- **Package dependency management** including upper bounds additions for boltzgen.0.9 and ppxx.2.5.0 due to ocaml-compiler-libs breaking changes tracked by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) ([#28023](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28023))
- **Cross-platform builds** enhanced through Windows/Cygwin configuration fixes in multiple conf packages and availability restrictions ([#28011](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28011))
- **OCaml 5.3 MSVC compatibility** investigation by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) addressing build detection conflicts ([#28005](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28005))
- **Repository documentation** improvements planned with [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) proposing wiki migration to main repository for better collaboration ([#28022](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28022))
- **Issue cleanup** maintenance by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) closing several legacy build issues and duplicates ([#24761](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/24761), [#27539](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27539), [#22147](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/22147), [#21593](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/21593), [#25933](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/25933))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on Windows platform support, package ecosystem consolidation, and infrastructure modernization efforts
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Windows platform prioritization** with dedicated CI fixes, platform-specific configuration packages, and MSVC toolchain support improvements
- **Package ecosystem consolidation** through deprecation warnings on legacy packages (duppy, dtools) and dependency cleanup in major packages like liquidsoap
- **Infrastructure modernization** including documentation migration from wiki to main repository and improved cross-platform build support
- **Unikernel ecosystem development** with comprehensive OCaml-Unikraft release providing complete toolchain for multiple architectures and deployment targets
summaries.contributors_summary: Active maintenance by core team with contributions from academia, infrastructure fixes, and new package releases
summaries.contributors:
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) led infrastructure improvements including dependency management ([#28023](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28023)), documentation planning ([#28022](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28022)), and repository explanation efforts ([#27796](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27796))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) identified and debugged Windows CI cache corruption affecting MinGW builds with detailed analysis ([#28007](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28007))
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) resolved Windows CI issues through cache invalidation and configuration fixes ([#28011](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28011), [#28016](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28016))
- [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) contributed CamlIDL 1.13 release for C interface generation ([#28025](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28025))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) published Base ecosystem v0.17.3 including comprehensive PPX and testing library updates ([#28012](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28012), [#27958](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27958))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) provided extensive issue maintenance, closing legacy problems and providing user support across multiple platform-specific issues
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) fixed ocaml-lsp-server dependencies and resolved package conflicts ([#28010](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28010), [#27955](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27955))
- [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) managed dependency constraints for kappa-library and ppxlib compatibility ([#28020](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28020), [#28019](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28019))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) investigated OCaml 5.3 MSVC build issues providing detailed error analysis ([#28005](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28005))

summaries.brief_summary: Extensive package ecosystem expansion with 12+ new releases including yojson 3.0.0, coq-lsp multi-version release, and maintenance updates
summaries.new_features_summary: New packages include spurs process management, coq-lsp multi-version support, yojson 3.0.0, and bitwuzla-cxx solver bindings
summaries.new_features:
- **New JSON library** yojson and yojson-five 3.0.0 released with updated API by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) ([2e3ff1f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/2e3ff1fe33))
- **Multi-version coq-lsp** releases for OCaml 8.17, 8.18, 8.19, 8.20, and 9.0 by [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) ([6f267ea](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/6f267eadc1), [2416148](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/2416148572), [4052cf1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/4052cf1a69), [7e4149c](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/7e4149c4a8), [1355ba2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/1355ba2b5c))
- **Process management library** spurs 0.1.1 for spawning and managing child processes ([e75d4c0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e75d4c02d2))
- **SMT solver bindings** bitwuzla-cxx 0.8.0 for C++ bindings to the Bitwuzla SMT solver ([056486b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/056486bf4b))
- **OpenGL bindings** tgls 0.9.0 thin bindings to OpenGL by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) ([d3f086b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d3f086bd0e))
- **Hexadecimal dumping** hxd 0.3.4 for pretty-printing binary data ([d224b3a](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d224b3a149))
- **Pretty printer** ppx_unreachable 1.1 for marking unreachable code ([38bbbf2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/38bbbf2851))
- **Code formatter** merge-fmt 0.4 for merging OCaml code formatting changes ([cd50f8d](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/cd50f8d61c))
- **Mirage networking** mirage-channel 5.0.0 for buffered channels in MirageOS ([d514cdf](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d514cdf32b))
summaries.activity_summary: Major maintenance wave affecting 171 packages with dependency updates, platform fixes, and repository maintenance
summaries.activity:
- **Extensive dependency maintenance** across multiple package families including atdgen (17 versions updated), lsp/ocaml-lsp-server (40+ versions), kind2 (13 versions), goblint (7 versions), and pa_ppx (10 versions) for consistency and compatibility
- **Platform compatibility improvements** including conf-clang-format Alpine 22 support ([160af9d](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/160af9d0c4)), conf-freeglut msys2 typo fix ([3666d7b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/3666d7b562)), and conf-gnuplot Windows/OpenBSD support ([1f3312b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/1f3312b11d))
- **Package availability updates** for OCaml 5.4 compatibility fixes ([eb0953b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/eb0953be2f)) and upper bound adjustments ([199664c](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/199664cad7))
- **Repository infrastructure** improvements with download mirror URLs added for ocamlfind ([883026b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/883026b00b)), source archive URLs for ocamlnet-4.1.9 ([056e15c](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/056e15c1134))
- **Quality assurance** through test disabling for specific packages where needed ([eed6bcc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/eed6bcc0193))
summaries.trends_summary: Package ecosystem maturation with comprehensive dependency management and multi-version compatibility focus
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Multi-version release strategy** demonstrated by coq-lsp releasing simultaneously for 5 different OCaml versions (8.17-9.0), showing ecosystem adaptation to multiple compiler versions
- **Dependency chain maintenance** with systematic updates across related packages (lsp ecosystem, atdgen family) indicating coordinated maintenance efforts
- **Platform compatibility expansion** with specific focus on Windows (msys2), Alpine Linux, and OpenBSD support across configuration packages
- **Repository quality improvements** through better download infrastructure, mirror URLs, and source archive management for package distribution reliability

summaries.brief_summary: New package releases including YOCaml 2.3.0 static site generator, LWD UI library 0.4, LLVM 19 bindings, and bug fixes for bin_prot build issues
summaries.new_features_summary: YOCaml 2.3.0 static site generator release, LWD 0.4 UI library with HTML backend, LLVM 19 OCaml bindings, ppxlib 0.37.0~5.4preview for OCaml 5.4
summaries.new_features:
- **YOCaml 2.3.0** static site generator framework released with comprehensive ecosystem including Markdown support, Git integration, and multiple template engines ([yocaml releases](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/8bf7740e426dd4ee4f8dcbd427977b0b144db9de))
- **LWD 0.4** lightweight reactive UI library with new HTML backend through `brr-lwd` and `tyxml-lwd` packages for browser applications ([lwd-0.4](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f96c4f16cc7eb44c5c16b7fcaf148546c8a18eba))
- **LLVM 19** OCaml bindings with both shared and static linking variants providing access to latest LLVM infrastructure ([llvm-19](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/502b1efb17ad0ef9bf6669b3c5b344fe250933a4))
- **OCaml 5.4 preview packages** including ppxlib 0.37.0~5.4preview, merlin 5.4.2~5.4preview, and ocaml-lsp-server 1.22.1~5.4preview for early testing ([5.4-preview](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/164308699cf74247b8ad3b002e88bd80a586c79e))
- **Docker utilities 8.2.8** updated dockerfile packages for container workflow improvements ([dockerfile-8.2.8](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e87e0d7ccd131f97e24187adb44170009ea6cec1))
- **bin_prot v0.17.0-1** patched version resolving compilation failures on OpenSUSE and FreeBSD systems ([bin_prot-fix](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/8bf7740e426dd4ee4f8dcbd427977b0b144db9de))
summaries.activity_summary: Package maintenance focused on OCaml 5.4 compatibility, dependency fixes, and ecosystem updates across 119 files
summaries.activity:
- **OCaml 5.4 readiness** tracked in ongoing coordination issue by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) covering platform tools including opam, dune, merlin, LSP server, and odoc ([#27916](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27916))
- **bin_prot compilation fixes** resolved long-standing build failures on OpenSUSE and FreeBSD by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) addressing linker and script execution issues ([#26005](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26005), [#27646](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27646))
- **Dependency constraint updates** including ppx_minidebug compatibility fixes with ppx_sexp_conv, lsp package csexp bounds correction, and cca package mirage-mtime conflict resolution ([dependency-fixes](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/d6dac59fa2c8901fe460b122760745f62467db858))
- **Package ecosystem expansion** with 12 new YOCaml modules for static site generation, trace library 0.10 for performance monitoring, and various utility packages including pageantty for SSH agent interaction ([ecosystem-growth](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/340624ff2e8df975ef571cc3153db11228e8b76709))
summaries.trends_summary: Preparation for OCaml 5.4 release with preview packages and compatibility testing across the ecosystem
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.4 preparation** with preview versions of core tools and libraries being released for compatibility testing and readiness validation
- **UI framework evolution** with LWD gaining browser support through new HTML backends, expanding beyond terminal interfaces
- **Static site generation** growth with comprehensive YOCaml ecosystem providing modern alternatives to existing solutions
- **Infrastructure modernization** including LLVM 19 support and updated container tooling for development workflows

- **System compatibility fixes** addressing platform-specific build issues including macOS ARM OpenBLAS support and Gentoo library naming
- **Community growth** through active maintainer recruitment and improved documentation to lower contribution barriers

summaries.brief_summary: Significant package repository expansion with 38 package updates across multiple ecosystem domains

summaries.activity_summary: Extensive package release activity with 35 new package versions spanning audio/video processing, machine learning, testing frameworks, and language tools
summaries.activity:
- **New package releases** included major version updates across diverse domains: FFmpeg audio/video processing suite (8 packages at 1.2.3), machine learning tools (arrayjit 0.5.2, neural_nets_lib 0.5.2, cudajit 0.7.0), testing frameworks (qcheck suite 0.8, domainslib 0.5.2), and language tools (jasmin 2025.02.1, pratter 5.0.1)
- **Standard library and compatibility updates** with stdcompat releasing versions 20.0 and 20.1, base package updating to v0.16.4, and subprocess utility reaching 0.2.1
- **Development tool enhancements** including trace framework updates (4 packages at 0.9.1), linol language server library (3 packages at 0.9), and conan framework expansion (5 packages at 0.0.6)
- **Package maintenance work** involved compatibility constraints for Alpine Linux distributions, OCaml version limitations, and build system configuration updates across multiple core packages
summaries.trends_summary: Active community growth with maintainer recruitment and cross-platform compatibility focus
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Community expansion initiative** with [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) launching maintainer recruitment receiving 13 volunteer responses for opam-repository maintenance [#27740](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27740)
- **Cross-platform compatibility improvements** addressing Alpine Linux distribution support and OCaml version constraints to ensure broader ecosystem compatibility
- **Domain-specific package growth** with significant additions in machine learning (GPU computing with CUDA support), multimedia processing (comprehensive FFmpeg bindings), and formal verification tools
summaries.contributors_summary: Active week with contributions from ecosystem maintainers focusing on package releases and platform compatibility
summaries.contributors:
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) initiated community maintainer recruitment effort and managed volunteer responses for opam-repository maintenance expansion [#27740](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27740)
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) reported OCaml compiler build failure on Linux/arm64 for ocaml-base-compiler.4.07.1 involving getcwd implementation [#27710](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27710)
- Multiple package authors contributed new releases including savonet team (FFmpeg bindings), ocaml-multicore team (testing frameworks), and individual maintainers across machine learning, formal verification, and development tools domains
- Platform compatibility work involved addressing Alpine Linux distribution constraints and OCaml version limitations across core packages

summaries.brief_summary: Exceptionally active week with 64 new package releases, including major Diffast 0.2 toolkit and YoCaml 2.2.0 static site generator

summaries.activity_summary: One new PR opened for Pds package update, with one fswatch release successfully merged after review discussions about dependency configuration
summaries.activity:

summaries.trends_summary: Strong focus on multi-language tooling with Diffast supporting 5 programming languages and comprehensive static site generation with YoCaml ecosystem
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Multi-language parsing ecosystem** development with Diffast 0.2 providing comprehensive code difference analysis for C++, Java, Python, Fortran, and Verilog through 21 specialized packages
- **Static site generation modernization** with YoCaml 2.2.0 delivering complete ecosystem including multiple template engines (Jingoo, Mustache), markup formats (Cmarkit, OMD), and backend support (EIO, Unix)
- **JavaScript/TypeScript toolchain expansion** with Melange 5.1.0 providing multiple OCaml compiler target versions for web development
- **Build system reliability** improvements through checksum-stable package references and cross-platform compatibility fixes for FreeBSD, Alpine Linux, and ARM32 architectures

summaries.trends_summary: Major ecosystem transitions with Rocq emerging as Coq successor and continued JavaScript/Windows platform support expansion
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Theorem proving evolution** with Rocq 9.0.0 establishing itself as the successor to Coq, representing a significant shift in the formal verification landscape
- **JavaScript compilation maturity** demonstrated by Melange 5.1.0 supporting multiple OCaml versions (4.14, 5.1, 5.2, 5.3) indicating robust cross-version compatibility
- **Documentation tooling advancement** with odoc 3.0.0 introducing enhanced driver architecture and markdown output capabilities for improved developer experience
- **Platform inclusivity** through Windows-specific package improvements (mbedtls configuration) and cross-platform build system enhancements
- **Dependency management modernization** with systematic ppxlib upper bounds maintenance and package compatibility updates across the ecosystem
summaries.contributors_summary: Community maintainers addressed platform compatibility issues and dependency synchronization across macOS, Windows, and Linux systems
summaries.contributors:
- [@nilsbecker](https://github.com/nilsbecker) reported OpenBLAS compilation issues on macOS ARM systems due to unsupported `-fopenmp` flag ([#27483](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27483))
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) identified and reported conf-libcurl installation failures on Windows platforms ([#27539](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27539))
- [Olaf Hering](https://github.com/olafhering) raised bin_prot synchronization concerns regarding missing merge from upstream janestreet repository ([#27646](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27646))
- Multiple package maintainers contributed major releases including Melange, Rocq, odoc, and alcotest teams providing substantial ecosystem updates
- Build system maintainers implemented platform-specific fixes for OpenBSD, SUSE Linux, and Windows environments enhancing cross-platform compatibility

summaries.trends_summary: Strong focus on package maintenance transparency through x-maintenance-intent declarations and systematic deprecation of outdated packages
summaries.emerging_trends:

summaries.discussions_summary: Key discussion on CI linting integration and repository breakage prevention mechanisms
summaries.notable_discussions:

- **Repository breakage analysis** following the color package incident, with discussions between [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder), [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS), and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) about strict mode usage in CI and prevention mechanisms ([#26956](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26956))
summaries.trends_summary: Ecosystem consolidation around modern OCaml versions, governance formalization, and proactive quality assurance integration
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Governance formalization** with the introduction of comprehensive repository policies and archiving procedures, establishing clear criteria for package inclusion and maintenance expectations
- **Quality assurance modernization** through integration of CI linting tools into publication workflows, shifting validation earlier in the development lifecycle to reduce manual review overhead
- **Legacy package deprecation** with systematic marking of outdated Solo5 and OCaml freestanding packages, reflecting ecosystem evolution toward modern alternatives
- **Major version coordination** with synchronized releases of core ecosystem packages (Dune, cohttp, eio) requiring extensive compatibility testing and dependency updates across the package ecosystem
